unnormalised: HDFC Bank's personal loan interest rates start from 10.75% p.a., with loan amounts ranging from Rs. 50,000 to Rs. 40 lakh. Processing fees are approx. 2.5% of the loan amount + applicable taxes. Folks are really taking these loans; heard my neighbour Sharma Ji just got a Rs. 15 lakh loan for his daughter’s wedding.
normalised: H-D-F-C Bank's personal loan interest rates start from ten point seven five percent per annum, with loan amounts ranging from rupees fifty thousand to rupees forty lakh. Processing fees are approximately two point five percent of the loan amount plus applicable taxes. Folks are really taking these loans; heard my neighbour Sharma Ji just got a rupee fifteen lakh loan for his daughter’s wedding.

unnormalised: SBI offers education loans starting at 8.25% for professional courses. They're also pushing these 'pre-approved' personal loans via SMS; got one myself yesterday offering Rs. 2 lakh! The repayment period can extend up to 15 yrs.
normalised: S-B-I offers education loans starting at eight point two five percent for professional courses. They're also pushing these 'pre-approved' personal loans via S-M-S; got one myself yesterday offering rupees two lakh! The repayment period can extend up to fifteen years.

unnormalised: FYI, Bajaj Finserv is offering home loans with interest rates starting from 8.50% & processing fees of up to 0.50% of the loan amount. Seems like everyone's chasing lower rates these days. Check their website for EMI options!
normalised: For your information, Bajaj Finserv is offering home loans with interest rates starting from eight point five zero percent and processing fees of up to zero point five zero percent of the loan amount. Seems like everyone's chasing lower rates these days. Check their website for E-M-I options!

unnormalised: RBI recently increased the repo rate by 0.25%, which means loans will get pricier in the coming months. Experts are saying this could impact housing demand in metros like Mumbai and Delhi. Better lock in those rates now, guys!
normalised: R-B-I recently increased the repo rate by zero point two five percent, which means loans will get pricier in the coming months. Experts are saying this could impact housing demand in metros like Mumbai and Delhi. Better lock in those rates now, guys!

unnormalised: ICICI Bank credit cards have annual fees ranging from Rs. 499 to Rs. 12,000, depending on the card type & benefits. They're offering 5x rewards on online spending this Diwali season. Make sure you read the fine print about those charges and late payment fees though!
normalised: I-C-I-C-I Bank credit cards have annual fees ranging from rupees four hundred and ninety nine to rupees twelve thousand, depending on the card type and benefits. They're offering five times rewards on online spending this Diwali season. Make sure you read the fine print about those charges and late payment fees though!
